summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and a contractor regarding the management of documents in the 'US v. Epstein (SW Returns)' Relativity database. The discussion focuses on securing non-responsive materials (397,365 documents) and ensuring only responsive documents (1,218,719 documents) remain accessible for the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Email coordination on securing non-responsive Epstein documents
events.description: Email exchange confirming the plan to lock off access to 397,365 non-responsive documents in the 'US v. Epstein (SW Returns)' database, leaving 1,218,719 responsive documents accessible for the Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The 'US v. Epstein (SW Returns)' database contained a total of 1,616,084 documents (397,365 non-responsive + 1,218,719 responsive).
Prosecutors sought to lock off access to all non-responsive materials in the database to limit review to only documents tagged 'Identified Responsive'.
The email chain demonstrates procedural steps taken by the U.S. Attorney's Office to manage evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
